# Faster builds. Happier developers.
BuildBuddy provides enterprise features for Bazel — the open source build system that allows you to build and test software 10x faster.
[Get Started for Free](https://buildbuddy.io/<https:/app.buildbuddy.io>)[Request a Demo](https://buildbuddy.io/</request-demo>)
TRUSTED BY THE BEST ENGINEERING TEAMS
![Spotify Logo](https://buildbuddy.io/img/spotify.svg)![Cisco Logo](https://buildbuddy.io/img/cisco.svg)![Asana Logo](https://buildbuddy.io/img/asana.svg)![Benchling Logo](https://buildbuddy.io/img/benchling.svg)![Retool Logo](https://buildbuddy.io/img/retool.svg)![Mercari Logo](https://buildbuddy.io/img/mercari.svg)![Verkada Logo](https://buildbuddy.io/img/verkada.svg)![Tecton Logo](https://buildbuddy.io/img/tecton.svg)
RBE
## Remote Build Execution
Massively parallel builds with just a few lines of configuration and no maintenance burden. BuildBuddy provides remote build execution and caching as a fully-managed cloud service. Supports custom Docker images, and automatically scales to thousands of worker nodes.
9,800,497,072 
Compute Minutes Saved
By organizations using BuildBuddy Cloud remote caching — that's 18,646 years not spent waiting for builds to finish.
## Unlock your Bazel build logs
BuildBuddy captures build logs, test logs, invocation details, target information, and artifacts — so you can dive deep into and easily share the details of each and every build.
## BuildBuddy is Enterprise Bazel
BuildBuddy brings the power of Bazel to your organization, along with mission-critical features, enterprise-grade stability, and 24/7 expert support.
Visibility
The BuildBuddy Results Store and Results UI gives you full visibility into your builds so you can debug failing tests, view invocation details, and track down slow targets.
Performance
With a built-in Remote Build Cache and Remote Build Execution, BuildBuddy gives you the tools to make your whole engineering organization more productive.
Collaboration
Share BuildBuddy links with co-workers to get your problems solved quickly — so you can get back to building.
## “BuildBuddy delivers the remote cache and remote execution performance we need without the maintenance burden. All while providing best in class visibility into our builds.”
Keith Smiley
Senior Staff Engineer at Modular & Lead Maintainer of Bazel's Apple rules
![Modular Logo](https://buildbuddy.io/img/modular-white.svg)

generated_description:
BuildBuddy is a young, innovative company founded in 2019 that focuses on enhancing the popular open-source build system, Bazel, with enterprise-level features. Situated in Palo Alto and emerging from Y Combinator's W20 batch, they aim to make software building significantly faster — often claiming up to 10 times quicker — and delight developers in the process.

The company's core offerings revolve around improving build processes through tools such as a Build & Test UI, Remote Execution, Remote Cache, and the BuildBuddy Command Line Interface (CLI). These features streamline not only the coding but also the testing phases of software development, providing deep visibility into build logs and collaboration tools that keep teams connected. This is especially vital for organizations that want to reduce build time significantly. In fact, BuildBuddy reports that its Cloud remote caching has saved users a staggering 9.8 billion compute minutes, translating to 18,646 years of time not spent waiting for builds — that’s a powerful selling point.

At its core, BuildBuddy is designed as an open-core product, offering robust features for individual developers for free, while larger enterprises can benefit from the more comprehensive tools and 24/7 support. This dual approach not only serves to build community trust but also aligns with the growing trend of making advanced technology accessible to smaller teams and open-source projects.

Currently, BuildBuddy operates with a compact but effective team of 15, led by Group Partner Dalton Caldwell, which allows for agile responses to customer needs and a nurturing of the company’s culture. They’ve attracted impressive clientele, including renowned engineering teams from companies like Spotify, Cisco, and Asana, solidifying their reputation in the developer tools space.

If you want to give BuildBuddy a whirl, they provide options to get started for free and a demo is just a request away. Their site (https://buildbuddy.io) offers a treasure trove of resources, documentation, and community engagement platforms to get developers onboard and building better today.

In summary, if you’re looking to supercharge your development process with a tool aimed at removing the headaches associated with build systems, BuildBuddy might just be your new best friend.
